carlhauser_client.Helpers package¶

Submodules¶

carlhauser_client.Helpers.dict_utilities module¶

carlhauser_client.Helpers.dict_utilities.apply_mapping(dict_to_modify: Dict, mapping: Dict) → Dict[source]¶

Modify all occurences in dict_to_modify of keys-values in mapping, by their value Ex : {“toto”:”tata”}, {“tata”:”new”} ==> {“toto”:”new”} :param dict_to_modify: The original dict :param mapping: dict of (values to be replaces) -> (new values) :return: the modified dict

carlhauser_client.Helpers.dict_utilities.apply_revert_mapping(dict_to_modify, mapping_to_revert: Dict)[source]¶

Revert the value/keys of a dictionnary and apply it to all occurences in dict_to_modify of keys-values in mapping, by their value Ex : {“toto”:”tata”}, {“new”:”tata”} ==> {“toto”:”new”} :param dict_to_modify: The original dict :param mapping_to_revert: mapping from name to name, to be reverted before application :return: Original dict modified with applied reversed dict

carlhauser_client.Helpers.dict_utilities.copy_id_to_image(dict_to_modify: Dict) → Dict[source]¶

From a dict of pictures/graphe json, copy ids of cluster and pictures to their ‘picture’ attribute Useful to have a visjs-classificator readable graph :param dict_to_modify: original dictionnary of pictures/clusters/edges .. :return: modified and readable by visjs-classificator graph

carlhauser_client.Helpers.dict_utilities.get_clear_matches(request)[source]¶

Extract a clean list of matches from a request : remove the picture itself from the matches :param request: result of a request, a dict :return: a clean list of matches (wihtout the picture itself)

carlhauser_client.Helpers.dict_utilities.revert_mapping(mapping: Dict) → Dict[source]¶

Revert the value/keys of a dictionnary. Ex : transform X->Y to Y->X for all values of a dict :param mapping: X -> Y dict :return: The reversed dict

carlhauser_client.Helpers.dict_utilities.update_values_dict(original_dict: Dict, future_dict: Dict, new_mapping: Dict) → Dict[source]¶

Recursively updates values of a nested dict by performing recursive calls Replace in <original_dict> all keys elements present in <new_mapping> by their value in <new_mapping> Ex : {“toto”:”tata”}, {“tata”:”new”} ==> {“toto”:”new”} :param original_dict: The original dict :param future_dict: The dict were the result will be stored (needed, because recursive calls) :param new_mapping: dict of (values to be replaces) -> (new values) :return: the modified dict
